title: How to Delete a Discord Server on Android

steps.title: Open Discord.
steps.content: Open Discord. Its icon looks like a white smiling gamepad on a blue background. If you aren’t yet signed in, enter your email address and password to do so now.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It’s at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the server you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap the server you want to delete. Servers are listed along the left side of the screen and your selected server will display to the right.

steps.title: Tap ⁝.
steps.content: Tap ⁝ . It’s at the top-right corner of the server screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . You'll see this gear icon in the icon menu that runs horizontally under the server's name.

steps.title: Tap ⁝ again.
steps.content: Tap ⁝ again. This is usually in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Delete Server.
steps.content: Tap Delete Server . This is usually the only option in the menu. If you don't see it, you might not be the owner of the server.

steps.title: Tap Delete Server to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Delete Server to confirm. The server is now deleted. [1] X Research source
